channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 19th September
item.description:
Might attract rats soon

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 340A, East Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous branches have now fallen, 19th September
item.description:
Dear all, a couple of weeks ago I reported that there were two large branches hanging dangerously, high up, not attached to the tree. Apparently you examined them and said they were fine and no action was required. As I had feared, both large branches (15ft long and 10inches thick) fell to the ground during the recent winds. You will be pleased to know that no one was injured or killed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A couple of branches need clearing away, 19th September
item.description:
Please can these branches that came down in the recent high winds be cleared away. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small pile of cuttings, 19th September
item.description:
Hi. There is a small pile of cuttings and brambles that need clearing away. There’s also a few branches that have fallen in the recent high winds. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small pile of cuttings and fallen branches, 19th September
item.description:
There is a small pile of cuttings under the copper beech tree. It’s cuttings and branches that have fallen during the recent high winds. Please can they be removed. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pallet has been left in the street (i.e., fly tipping), 19th September
item.description:
Pallet has been left in the street blocking the path. Has been propped up against the Torr Road sign.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Torr Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rat in the park, 19th September
item.description:
I’ve just seen a rat run up the stream and into the rocks. It then ran behind the rocks (top arrow) and didn’t come back out. Please can something be done. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Skip placed across drop kerb, pavement and road. Not illuminated and dangerous material overhanging, 19th September
item.description:
Its a clear danger to the public and should not be there
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swanley Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large pile of cuttings and fallen branches, 19th September
item.description:
There is a very large pile of cuttings and branches that have come down during the recent high winds. It’s just beyond the ice house, on the right hand side before you get to the lawn. Please can it all be taken away. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Chase, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole/sinkhole in middle of road, 19th September
item.description:
Pothole has been fixed multiple times and keeps returning, now very dangerous to road users. Approx 20-30cm deep, 60-70cm wide
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Harold Road, Upper Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees over hanging walk way, 19th September
item.description:
Trees hanging over pavement in Garden Walk BR3 4XB, branches are breaking off & are considered dangerous, Residents in this area are mainly elderly & or disabled. This issue has been brought to my attention because I can go online
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garden Walk, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Rubbish dumped

item.title: Mattress and duvet flytipped, 19th September

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterman's Way, Rotherhithe, London

item.title: Dangerous trees obstructing walk way, 19th September
item.description:
Tree are so heavy with ivy they are breaking, this is the second time this has happened on this bridge with branches obstructing the ealk way. All along the near by stretch of path lots of tress are very low hanging and broken with heavy ivy. Sometimes blocking the stream and causing flooding. I can see the locksbottom end of this path has had tree maintenance. I suggest the whole path way up to crofton Shepperton road needs assessing before the winter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sparrow Drive, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattresses and bed frame, 19th September
item.description:
The mattresses have been in the walled area for so long that there is vegetation growing over them. The bed frame has been by the bin area for a few months now. Area between car park for Janet Court and the side of 2 East Street
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Street, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of bath, 19th September
item.description:
Has been here for over a week. Was reported earlier, I was notified as being resolved but the waste is still here

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glebe Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Brondesbury Villas on BT Junction Box by Post Office, 19th September
item.description:
Flyposting on junction box. Note that flyposting is prevalent at other such locations and lamp columns along the High Road, including at the junction of Glengall Road and Kilburn High Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brondesbury Villas, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bricks lifted as tree roots extended and grown underneath, 19th September
item.description:
